name: St. Mary MacKillop

locations.description: Founder of the Sisters of St. Joseph, first Australian saint

summary: Mary MacKillop, also known as St. Mary of the Cross, was an Australian religious sister who co-founded the Sisters of St. Joseph of the Sacred Heart. She dedicated her life to educating poor children in rural Australia. She faced significant opposition, including excommunication, but was later vindicated. She was the first Australian to be canonized and is the patron saint of Australia.
